file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 29-30-01-04 - RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the reservoir quantity indicator. B. You can get access to the reservoir quantity indicator of system 1 through access panel 193BL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). C. You can get access to the reservoir quantity indicator of system 2 through access panel 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - RE- ALL 29-30-01-000-801-A MOVAL RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - IN- ALL 29-30-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 29-30-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-30-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the reservoir quantity indicator. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP AMM TASK 29-10-05-000-801-A/400 RESERVOIR ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber gloves, resistant to phosphate Protection for the hands 1 available ester-base fluid Commercially Rubber gloves, resistant to phosphate Protection for the eyes 1 available ester-base fluid Commercially To collect the hydraulic fluid when you dis- Drip Pan 1 available connect the hydraulic line F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 1 and 1 Does the task system 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-30-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (them). (2) Depressurize the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Remove access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE GOGGLES AND RUBBER GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Remove the reservoir assembly ( AMM TASK 29-10-05-000-801-A/400). NOTE: To get access to the attachment screws of the reservoir quantity indicator of system 1, it is necessary to remove the attachment support from the reservoir assembly. Refer to the last revision of Parker CMM 29-11-14 to remove the reservoir quantity indicator. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 29-30-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-30-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. RESERVOIR QUANTITY INDICATOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the reservoir quantity indicator. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - BLEED OF AIR AMM TASK 29-10-05-400-801-A/400 RESERVOIR ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Hydraulic compartment of system 1 and 1 Does the task system 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-30-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Refer to the last revision of Parker CMM 29-11-14 to install the reservoir quantity indicator. (2) Install the reservoir assembly ( AMM TASK 29-10-05-400-801-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 and (or) ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breaker(s) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (them). (2) Pressurize the related hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200) and make sure that there are no leaks in the reservoir quantity indicator. (3) Do the bleed of air from the hydraulic system lines ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/ 200). (4) Install access panel 193BL and (or) 193CR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 29-30-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
